title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, and the user tries to open it in another editor by right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With' -> 'System Editor', nothing happens. There is no warning message or error message displayed. We believe that WSAD should have a safety feature where it doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
EB: However, there should be a warning message or error message displayed, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or indicating that they should close all file first.
SR:
1. Close any open files in the editor.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file should open in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file.
6. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
7. A warning message or error message should be displayed, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or indicating that they should close all file first.
